Name: Flash Injection
Description: An attacker tricks a victim to execute malicious flash content that executes commands or makes flash calls specified by the attacker. One example of this attack is cross-site flashing, an attacker controlled parameter to a reference call loads from content specified by the attacker.
Mitigations: ::Implementation: remove sensitive information such as user name and password in the SWF file.::Implementation: use validation on both client and server side.::Implementation: remove debug information.::Implementation: use SSL when loading external data::Implementation: use crossdomain.xml file to allow the application domain to load stuff or the SWF file called by other domain.::
Example Instances: ::In the following example, the SWF file contains getURL('javascript:SomeFunc(someValue)','','GET') A request like http://example.com/noundef.swf?a=0:0;alert('XSS') becomes javascript:SomeFunc(someValue)?a=0:0;alert(123)::
